categories.name: gandhi_early_life
categories.description: Test cases about Gandhi's early life and education

test_cases.prompt: Where and when was Mahatma Gandhi born?
test_cases.expected_answer: Mahatma Gandhi was born on October 2, 1869, in Porbandar, Gujarat, India.
Gandhi studied law in London at the Inner Temple.

test_cases.prompt: How long did Gandhi stay in South Africa?
test_cases.expected_answer: Gandhi stayed in South Africa for 21 years, from 1893 to 1914.

categories.name: gandhi_independence_movement
categories.description: Test cases about Gandhi's role in India's independence movement

test_cases.expected_answer: The Salt March was a peaceful protest led by Gandhi in 1930 against the British salt tax. He walked 240 miles to the sea to make salt.

test_cases.prompt: What was the Quit India Movement?
test_cases.expected_answer: The Quit India Movement was a major campaign started by Gandhi in 1942 demanding immediate independence for India from British rule.

test_cases.prompt: What was Gandhi's main method of protest?
test_cases.expected_answer: Gandhi's main method of protest was nonviolent resistance and civil disobedience.

categories.name: gandhi_philosophy
categories.description: Test cases about Gandhi's philosophical beliefs and principles

test_cases.expected_answer: Satyagraha means 'truth force' or 'soul force' and was Gandhi's method of nonviolent resistance.

test_cases.prompt: What was Gandhi's view on violence?
test_cases.expected_answer: Gandhi strongly believed in non-violence (Ahimsa) and peaceful methods of protest.
Swaraj means self-rule or self-governance, which was Gandhi's vision for India's independence.

categories.name: gandhi_personal_life
categories.description: Test cases about Gandhi's personal life and habits

test_cases.expected_answer: Gandhi's daily routine included prayer, spinning on the charkha, walking, and maintaining a simple vegetarian diet.
Gandhi was a strict vegetarian and often fasted as part of his spiritual practice.
Gandhi's favorite book was the Bhagavad Gita, which greatly influenced his philosophy.

categories.name: gandhi_legacy
categories.description: Test cases about Gandhi's impact and legacy

test_cases.prompt: Who was influenced by Gandhi's nonviolence?
test_cases.expected_answer: Martin Luther King Jr. was greatly influenced by Gandhi's philosophy of nonviolence.

test_cases.prompt: What is Gandhi's birthday celebrated as?
test_cases.expected_answer: Gandhi's birthday, October 2, is celebrated as the International Day of Non-Violence.

test_cases.prompt: What did Gandhi say about change?
test_cases.expected_answer: Gandhi famously said, 'Be the change you wish to see in the world.'

categories.name: gandhi_education
categories.description: Test cases about Gandhi's views on education

test_cases.prompt: What was Gandhi's education system called?
test_cases.expected_answer: Gandhi's education system was called 'Nai Talim' or Basic Education.

test_cases.prompt: What did Gandhi think about manual work?
test_cases.expected_answer: Gandhi believed that manual work and education should go together.

categories.name: gandhi_environment
categories.description: Test cases about Gandhi's environmental views

test_cases.prompt: What was Gandhi's famous quote about needs and greed?
test_cases.expected_answer: Gandhi said, 'The world has enough for everyone's need, but not enough for everyone's greed.'

test_cases.prompt: What did Gandhi promote for sustainable living?
test_cases.expected_answer: Gandhi promoted simple living, minimal consumption, and self-sufficiency.
